item.title: A Simple Linear Regression
item.description: We build a linear regression below. Simple linear regression is of the form \[Y_i = \beta_0 + \beta_1X_i + \varepsilon_i\] where \(\varepsilon_i \sim N(0,\sigma^2)\), with \(\sigma\) be a constant. fit = lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars) b = coef(summary(fit)) plot(fit) The slope of the regression is 3.9324088.
